name: Buckler
text: 1 @armour@. This can be used even if you have a @2H:two-handed@ weapon.

name: Chain mail
text: 3 @armour@

name: Helmet
text: 1 @armour@, -1 vigilance

name: Shield
text: 4 @armour@

name: Tower shield
text: +4, 5 @armour@

name: Bait
text: Take +5 to make an animal do what you want. Comes in vegetarian, meat, and bug versions.

name: Blanket
text: When you check to jump through a fire, on success you may instead use this to reduce its POW by 5.

name: Boots
text: -1 stealth, +2 vs ground traps

name: Caltrops
text: Can be laid for a trap inflicting @bleeding@ and -5 athletics ueob.

name: Citronella oil
text: Dogs and bugs hate this.

name: Fishing rod
text: By a body of water with fish, you may sacrifice a unit of bug or meat bait and check END+vig vs 12; on a pass, after 2 hours, you get a fish worth a day's supplies.

name: Lamp
text: Provides bright light within 2m and dim within 2m more. Oil not included, but not tracked.

name: Lockpick
text: +5 to pick locks.

name: Matches
text: Start a POW=1 fire.

name: Medical kit
text: +5 to first aid checks. Includes bandages, alcohol, scissors, tweezers.

name: Oil
text: Lubricate a door to prevent it blowing a stealth check.

name: Pitons
text: With a hammer, take +5 to climb checks.

name: Provisions
text: Enough food for a day. If you don't eat, take 1 @Injury@ and you don't heal @Injury@ until the next day when you eat.

name: Rope
text: 10m of hemp rope. Indicative uses are to safely climb up or down from a ledge, provided you can tie it off; tie someone up (they can make a @slow@ AGI+ath vs MET+knowledge check to either break free or take 1 @Injury@); to make a leash for an animal; to make a lasso (weapon with thrown net ranged +2); to make a snare trap.

name: Soft shoes
text: +1 to stealth.

name: Arrow
text: Fired from a bow.

name: Crossbow
text: +3. No, I'm not going to design separate crossbow bolts that do the exact same thing as arrows.

name: Crowbar
text: +4. Can be used to open locked doors quickly.

name: Grenade
text: Has an associated condition, such as tangled (as for glue), fire, or poison. When you make a successful attack with this, aeor everyone within a 2m radius of the target checks END+ath vs the manufacturer's POW+knowledge, and takes the condition on a fail. You may target open space, but if you hit a target, they take the condition automatically and do not lose focus from being hit.

name: Longsword
text: +6. If you can use it two-handed, take an additional +1.

name: Main gauche
text: +3. May be equipped in the off hand, giving only +1.

name: Rock
text: +1. May be treated as @consumed@, but one typically doesn't run out of rocks.

name: Sling
text: +3. Technically @loaded rock@, if there aren't any around.
